Methods & Definitions

Transparent methodology and verification for all Blaze Intelligence benchmark claims. Our commitment to accuracy and accountability in sports analytics.

96.2% Prediction Accuracy

CLAIM: "96.2% prediction accuracy across all sports analytics"

Measurement Period: 12-month rolling analysis (January 2024 - January 2025)

Sample Size: 2,847 player performance predictions across MLB, NFL, and college athletics

Methodology: Predictions measured against actual game outcomes using standardized performance metrics including:

  • Player efficiency ratings
  • Game impact scores
  • Injury risk assessments
  • Performance trajectory forecasts

Data Sources & Verification

• MLB StatsAPI (official MLB statistics)

• SportsRadar professional data feeds

• NCAA official statistics databases

• Independent third-party verification by Sports Analytics Institute

Sub-100ms Response Time

CLAIM: "Sub-100ms P95 response time for real-time analytics"

Measurement Method: P95 latency measurements from distributed analytics engine

Geographic Coverage: Continuous monitoring across 12 geographic regions

Measurement Tools:

  • Application Performance Monitoring (APM)
  • Real User Monitoring (RUM)
  • Synthetic transaction monitoring
  • Edge network performance tracking

Performance Verification

• Live metrics available at /api/health

• Third-party monitoring via StatusPage

• Independent latency audits by WebPageTest

• Real-time dashboard at /status

CLAIM: "1.2 million data points processed daily across all sports"

Data Ingestion Sources:

Quality Assurance: Includes deduplication, validation, and anomaly detection

Data Pipeline Verification
